(
    id          INTEGER not null
        primary key autoincrement,
    language    TEXT,
    setCode     TEXT
        references sets (code)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
    translation TEXT
);

content.text: Wait, I see 10 rows but let me check — the query for COUNT(DISTINCT translation) returned 9. Let me verify if there are duplicate translations among these.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT translation, COUNT(*) FROM set_translations WHERE setCode = '10E' AND translation IS NOT NULL GROUP BY translation HAVING COUNT(*) > 1"

content.text:
That confirms it: "Chinese Simplified" and "Chinese Traditional" both have the same translation text "核心系列第十版", so there are 10 rows but only 9 **distinct** translations.

The claim says there are 9 distinct translations of the set name "Tenth Edition", and the database confirms exactly 9 distinct non-null translations.
